entry.title: Spirit of the Few Monument (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Spirit of the Few Monument at Hawkinge is based on a photograph of Alan Eckford and other pilots of No. 32 Squadron (pictured) during the Battle of Britain?

entry.title: geology of the Ellsworth Mountains (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the geology of the Ellsworth Mountains was explored by geologists using motor toboggans in 1961?

entry.title: Galina Pisarenko (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that soprano Galina Pisarenko studied economics, English, and Norwegian at the same time she was studying to become a professional opera singer?

entry.title: Parasitic Engineering (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Parasitic Engineering was named as a reference to a MITS co-founder calling third-party hardware vendors "parasite companies"?

entry.title: Volodymyr Kozhukhar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Volodymyr Kozhukhar, the chief conductor of the National Opera of Ukraine in Kyiv, led Lysenko's opera Taras Bulba and Shchedrin's ballet Carmen Suite?

entry.title: Yume Nikki (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that so little is known about the reclusive developer of Yume Nikki that its publisher Kadokawa Games had to debunk rumors that they had died in the 2011 Tōhoku earthquake?

entry.title: Jack Melchor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jack Melchor stayed at Claridge's annually over a 40-year period?

entry.title: Railway with a Heart of Gold (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the documentary Railway with a Heart of Gold has actual footage of a derailment captured whilst the filmmaker was attached to the side of the train?
